verses.17: "Here I will make a horn grow for David and set up a lamp for my anointed one.
verses.1: O LORD, remember David and all the hardships he endured.
verses.16: I will clothe her priests with salvation, and her saints will ever sing for joy.
verses.2: He swore an oath to the LORD and made a vow to the Mighty One of Jacob:
verses.3: "I will not enter my house or go to my bed-
verses.18: I will clothe his enemies with shame, but the crown on his head will be resplendent."
verses.4: I will allow no sleep to my eyes, no slumber to my eyelids,
verses.5: till I find a place for the LORD, a dwelling for the Mighty One of Jacob."
verses.6: We heard it in Ephrathah, we came upon it in the fields of Jaar:
verses.7: "Let us go to his dwelling place; let us worship at his footstool-
verses.8: arise, O LORD, and come to your resting place, you and the ark of your might.
verses.9: May your priests be clothed with righteousness; may your saints sing for joy."
verses.10: For the sake of David your servant, do not reject your anointed one.
verses.11: The LORD swore an oath to David, a sure oath that he will not revoke: "One of your own descendants I will place on your throne-
verses.12: if your sons keep my covenant and the statutes I teach them, then their sons will sit on your throne for ever and ever."
verses.13: For the LORD has chosen Zion, he has desired it for his dwelling:
verses.14: "This is my resting place for ever and ever; here I will sit enthroned, for I have desired it-
verses.15: I will bless her with abundant provisions; her poor will I satisfy with food.
